intro: Osmoxylon lineare, commonly known as the linear osmoxylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to poor soil conditions and limited water availability. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in arid environments.
